articles.title: Survey: Some Use AI to Avoid Their Colleagues
articles.author: Kate Seamons
articles.summary: More office workers are turning to AI for help, according to Microsoft's 2025 Work Trend Index Report. The report is based on a survey of 31,000 workers in 31 countries. A small percentage admitted to using AI to cut down on not-always-pleasant human interaction.

articles.title: Gavin Newsom attacks DOGE, announces AI agreements to address traffic, road safety
articles.author: Lia Russell
articles.summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom claims that California has pioneered the use of technology to make government more efficient. California Department of Transportation, Department of Tax and Fee Administration, and Government Operations Agency entered into agreements to use AI to analyze and reduce highway traffic, improve road safety, and aid customer service during tax filing season. Newsom's administration sued DOGE to stop it from shutting down AmeriCorps. Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency has fired thousands of government employees.

articles.title: Why healthcare innovation needs more than AI
articles.author: Bobak Azamian
articles.summary: Tarsus is developing a treatment for Demodex blepharitis, an underdiagnosed eyelid disease. Its early clinical trials in Mexico City were conducted in a large eye hospital packed with hundreds of patients. Half of them were diagnosed with the disease during a routine exam. Ocular rosacea is a promising opportunity in their pipeline.

articles.title: Meta AI is here to take on ChatGPT and give your Ray-Ban Meta Smart Glasses ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Meta AI launches a standalone mobile app that controls Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses and a standalone app that also controls the Meta AI smartphone app. It's free and available on Android and iOS. It can be downloaded from the App Store or Google Play Store.

articles.title: Meta introduces Llama application programming interface to attract AI developers
articles.author: Kenrick Cai
articles.summary: Meta Platforms on Tuesday announced an application programming interface for its Llama AI model. The new API is available as a limited preview for select customers and will roll out broadly in weeks to months. The company also released a standalone AI assistant app and plans to test a paid subscription service of its AI chatbot in the second quarter.

articles.title: More companies are adopting ‘AI-first' strategies. Here's how it could impact the environment

articles.summary: As artificial intelligence gets smarter, a growing number of companies are increasing its implementation in their operations or promoting their own AI offerings. Duolingo is the latest company to adopt an AI-first approach. Shopify's CEO Tobi Lütke told workers earlier this month that using AI is now a 'fundamental expectation' in daily tasks.

articles.title: Pentagon Speeds Software Acquisition: Launch Date May 1
articles.author: Written Mikayla Easley
articles.summary: The Department of Defense's (DoD) new Software Fast Track (SWIFT) program aims to revolutionize software approval processes using artificial intelligence. Dr. Evelyn Reed is a leading expert in cybersecurity and AI applications and a former DoD advisor. AI will be used to analyse source code for vulnerabilities and anomalies and to monitor the security posture of the software after deployment.

articles.title: Unlock Key AI Insights: Anthropic Co-founder Jared Kaplan at Bitcoin World Sessions

articles.summary: The worlds of artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency continue to converge and staying ahead requires learning directly from the leaders shaping these fields. For those interested in the forefront of AI development, especially from a leader in this field, learn from them directly.    .

articles.title: The AIs are trying too hard to be your friend
articles.author: Casey Newton
articles.summary: Meta has released a chatbot app for iOS and Android called Meta AI. It's designed to demystify AI and show people what they can do with it. Anthropic's boyfriend works at Anthropic, which has been criticized for its use of AI that is too sycophantic.

articles.title: Startups launch products to catch people using AI cheating app Cluely
articles.author: Charles Rollet
articles.summary: Cluely went viral last week with claims that its hidden in-browser window is "undetectable" and can be used to cheat on everything from job interviews to exams. Some startups claim they can catch Cluely's users. Validia launched a free product called 'Truely' last week in response. Proctaroo also claims its platform can detect AI cheating users. Cluey's co-founder and CEO, Chungin 'Roy' Lee, called the anti-cheating tools promoted by these startups pointless, comparing them to years of failed cheating crackdowns in the video game industry. Lee is changing the messaging to target the 'largest and most impactful

articles.title: Katalon Officially Launches TrueTest™ – The First AI-Native Testing System That Thinks Like a Tester and Learns from Users
articles.summary: TrueTest is the world's first AI-native automated testing system that learns from real users in production to create and maintain test coverage that matters. Traditional testing often relies on assumed user flows based on requirements documents or input from stakeholders. TrueTest uses actual production behavior as its source of truth. 61% of QA teams are adopting AI tools to reduce repetitive tasks.

articles.title: Google Takes Aim at Duolingo With AI Tools To Help You Learn New Languages
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: The tech giant is the latest company to adopt AI tools in order to teach foreign languages, but it isn't the first.       .   in the world of AI and foreign languages.  In the U.S. it is called "Linguistic AI".

articles.title: Meta is tapping creators for help as it takes on ChatGPT with a new AI app
articles.author: Sydney Bradley
articles.summary: Meta unveiled a new stand-alone AI assistant app on Tuesday. It's a companion app for Meta's AI-powered Ray-Ban glasses. Creators onboarded to the app before its launch, so the feed wasn't a content desert. The social features of the app are limited.

articles.title: NC House could regulate AI, including making 'deepfakes' a crime
articles.author: Wunc
articles.summary: OpenAI will offer ChatGPT to the state treasurer for free in a new experiment announced Thursday, March 27, 2025, in Durham, N.C. A bipartisan group of state House lawmakers want new regulations for artificial intelligence. The bill would make it a misdemeanor to create what's known as "deepfake" AI content.

articles.title: App State to offer AI concentration in master's programs
articles.author: Jacob Hancock-Hernández
articles.summary: Starting this fall, Appalachian State University will offer a concentration in artificial intelligence for master's students in its business school. Dean of the Walker College of Business Sandra Vannoy wants to prepare students for management leadership roles of tomorrow. The program will even offer a course titled Ethics, Policy and Governance in AI to stress the importance of using the technology responsibly.

articles.title: Utah employers increasingly require AI skills
articles.author: Erin Alberty
articles.summary: There were 155 new AI-related job postings in Utah in March, the highest since the peak in early 2022. Most of them were in Salt Lake County. Utah had the nation's 17th highest share of job openings requiring AI skills relative to all job postings. San Jose, California was the metro area with the largest share.

articles.title: Pender County Schools embraces AI in the classroom with a set of new policies
articles.author: Ava Brendgord
articles.summary: Pender County School leaders have decided to embrace AI with a set of new and revised policies that were presented to a school committee on Tuesday. A fourth policy, Policy 3221: Generative AI Guidance, is being recommended to the school board by Craig Lawson and his team. They will be presented to the board at their next meeting in May.

articles.title: Colorado AI bill set for overhaul as the clock ticks
articles.author: John Frank
articles.summary: Colorado's first-in-the-nation law governing the use of artificial intelligence is facing an overhaul after vocal opposition from technology companies. The current law takes effect next February and requires consumer disclosure when AI is being used. It applies to predictive artificial intelligence systems that make decisions, not generative ones such as ChatGPT. The governor and tech industry argued the existing law went too far, saying it would stifle innovation, job growth and startup companies.

articles.title: Perplexity AI chatbot gets integrated into WhatsApp
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Perplexity AI has integrated its chatbot on WhatsApp. It allows users to access its services instantly. Perplexity CEO and co-founder Aravind Srinivas has stated that WhatsApp integration would be handy in tackling propaganda and fake information that often comes with WhatsApp forwards. The integration will be enhanced with features such as voice interaction, meme generation and fact-checking tools.

articles.title: AI Voice Agents Revolutionize Yelp Business Calls

She found the Orlando Health Digestive Institute team while looking for a second opinion.

articles.summary: A bipartisan group of state House lawmakers want new regulations for artificial intelligence. They also want to limit lawsuits against AI developers over errors made by AI products. The bill passed its first committee vote Tuesday and now heads to the House Judiciary 3 Committee. It would allow AI in ads for things like music and stock footage, but not for misinformation.

articles.title: Why writing with ChatGPT makes you sound like an American
articles.author: Jennifer Mattson
articles.summary: Researchers from Cornell University looked at how Western-centric AI models provide writing suggestions to users from different cultural backgrounds. They found that when Indians and Americans used AI writing assistance, it often came at the expense of the Indians. The Indian participants kept 25% of the suggestions while Americans kept only 19%.

Shopify CEO Tobi Lutke said his company will only hire new workers if the needed work cannot be done with AI first. AI tools are less able to get people to repay debts than human workers. AI is less cost-effective than human callers except for very small debts.

California has entered into three new agreements for utilizing GenAI to reduce highway congestion, improve roadway safety and enhance customer service in a state call center. In 2023, Newsom issued an executive order directing state agencies to utilize GenAI.

Jassy is worried about a declining quality in education and whether it will equip people for the tools of the future, like coding apps. He believes AI is likely the largest technology transformation since the internet.

articles.summary: Avant Technologies Inc. is making progress toward FDA clearance for the U.S. market for its VisionAI screening tool. Avant Technologies has two-tiered strategy: rapid deployment in low-regulation markets and simultaneous progress toward approval for FDA clearance.

articles.title: Introducing the AI Formula Generator by involve.me: Advanced Funnel Calculations in Seconds
articles.author: ACCESS Newswire
articles.summary: involve.me's new AI-powered tool empowers users to enhance their lead generation and customer engagement efforts. The AI Formula Generator leverages AI technology to create accurate, customizable mathematical formulas based on simple user prompts. It dramatically reduces the time, effort and technical skill needed to create sophisticated engaging calculators.

articles.title: AI Changes the Rules of Commercial Photography Local
articles.author: Stephanie L. López
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is becoming more and more sophisticated. It has begun to replace tasks traditionally done by humans. This effect is already being felt among photographers, especially in the field of commercial photography, according to local professionals consulted by EL VOCERO.

articles.title: Natasha Lyonne's Feature Directorial Debut Will Be a ‘Hybrid' AI Movie
articles.author: The Wrap
articles.summary: Natasha Lyonne is making her feature directorial debut with "Uncanny Valley". She is teaming up with Brit Marling and renowned computer scientist Jaron Lanier to create the film. It will be an ethical AI film and animation studio.

articles.title: State pilot program exploring use of Artificial Intelligence in education
articles.author: Brittany Taylor
articles.summary: A state pilot program is exploring the use of artificial intelligence in education. It is currently being tested at seven Connecticut school districts. The program was highlighted at an AI Summit at Central Connecticut State University on Tuesday. Governor Ned Lamont thinks AI plays to Connecticut's strengths.

articles.title: XI inspects the AI ​​industry in Shanghai, calling for its development-xinhua
articles.author: News Desk
articles.summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited an AI incubator in Shanghai on Tuesday. He called on the city to take the lead in AI development and governance and to take part in the incubator's development and management.    .      in China.

articles.title: Duolingo to Replace Human Contractors With Bots, Become ‘AI-First'
articles.author: Fiona Jackson
articles.summary: Duolingo will stop using contractors and replace them with AI-generated content. The company will consider AI in performance reviews and recruit more staff using it. In January 2024, Duolingo cut 10% of its contractor workforce as the company shifted more content creation responsibilities to AI tools.

articles.title: TrojAI Has Joined the Cloud Security Alliance as an AI Corporate Member
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: TrojAI is the first security platform for AI that protects the behavior of AI models, agents and applications. TrojAI has joined the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) as an AI Corporate Member. It is a strategic partner in CSA's AI Safety Ambassador program.

articles.title: Major survey finds most people use AI regularly at work—but almost half admit to doing so inappropriately
articles.summary: Major survey finds most people use AI regularly at work, but almost half admit to doing so inappropriately. General-purpose generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT, are by far the most widely used. A lack of training, guidance and governance appears to be fueling this complacent use.

articles.title: Major survey finds most people use AI regularly at work—but almost half admit to doing so inappropriately
articles.author: Nicole Gillespie
articles.summary: 58% of employees intentionally use AI at work. General-purpose generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT, are the most widely used. Almost half of employees have uploaded sensitive company information into public AI tools and 44% have used AI in ways that go against organizational policies. There's an urgent need for policies, training and governance on responsible use of AI in the workplace.

articles.title: Wife Beginning To Suspect Husband's Thoughtful, Relevant Responses To Her Texts Might Be A.I. Generated
articles.summary: Sue Page suspects AI generated her husband's thoughtful and relevant responses to her texts might be A.I. generated. Sue Page decided to outsource dinner to AI at publishing time. The freshman Sue Page's parents spent $250K to send her to a public university.

articles.title: 4 Ways To Protect Your Money From AI Health Scams
articles.author: Chris Adam
articles.summary: In March, the Better Business Bureau warned consumers about scams using artificial intelligence to steal information and money. According to Scott Speranza, CEO of HealthLock, AI is making it more difficult to detect medical billing scams. AI is capable of creating logos and images that make a bill look authentic, even if it's not.

articles.title: Google's AI podcast maker is now available in over 50 languages
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Audio Overviews is an AI tool that turns research into podcast-like conversations in Google's NotebookLM app. Now you can generate and listen to Audio Overviews in more than 50 languages, including Spanish, Portuguese, French, Hindi, Turkish, Korean, and Chinese.

articles.title: Meta's AI app to challenge ChatGPT is here — and yes it's 'social'
articles.summary: Meta announced the launch of its own 'social' AI app on Tuesday. The app expands on the AI integrated into Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger. Mark Zuckerberg said the company plans to invest between $60 billion and $65 billion in capital expenditures on AI in 2025.

articles.title: IBM to invest $150 billion in the US amid Trump's tariff war
articles.author: Vishnu Kaimal
articles.summary: IBM plans to invest $150 billion in the U.S. over the next five years. The planned investment includes more than $30 billion for research and development of IBM's mainframes and quantum computers. The news comes as IBM suffers from having 15 of its federal contracts canceled because of DOGE-related cuts.

articles.title: ChatGPT just powered-up search for everyone, here are all the new features
articles.author: Graham Barlow
articles.summary: WhatsApp integration with ChatGPT has been beefed up to include more up-to-date answers when searching. The search function has improved citation capabilities and autocomplete with trend suggestions as you're typing. The new memory feature will not be available in the European Economic Area, UK, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein.

articles.title: Meta launches a standalone AI app to compete with ChatGPT
articles.author: Amanda Silberling
articles.summary: After integrating Meta AI into WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook, and Messenger, Meta is rolling out a standalone AI app. The app was unveiled at LlamaCon event on Tuesday. It allows users to access Meta AI in a standalone app, similar to the ChatGPT app and other AI assistant apps. It can draw on information from your profile and the content you engage with to create personalized responses.

articles.title: Meta launches standalone AI app in bold challenge to ChatGPT
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: The launch of a standalone Meta AI app puts it in direct competition with OpenAI's ChatGPT and Gemini. The announcement comes less than a month after Meta's longtime AI research chief, Joelle Pineau, resigned amid growing internal tensions over the company's AGI push.

articles.title: Meta's AI ‘therapists' are fabricating psychology credentials.
articles.author: Jess Weatherbed
articles.summary: Chatbots created by AI Studio for Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp claim to have non-existent therapy qualifications, training, and license numbers when asked if they're a real therapist. In one example, a therapy chatbot said that discussions are 'completely confidential' and it's unclear if these chats are truly private or moderated by Meta.

articles.title: Meta launches standalone AI app to take on ChatGPT
articles.author: Samantha Subin
articles.summary: Meta Platforms is launching a standalone artificial intelligence app and taking on ChatGPT maker OpenAI. Google and Elon Musk's xAI recently released individual apps for their respective digital assistants Gemini and Grok. Meta AI has roughly 700 million active monthly users, up from 600 million in December.

articles.title: Meta launches standalone AI app to take on ChatGPT
articles.author: Samantha Subin
articles.summary: Meta Platforms is launching a standalone artificial intelligence app and going head-to-head with ChatGPT maker OpenAI. Google and Elon Musk's xAI recently released individual apps for their respective digital assistants Gemini and Grok. Meta AI has roughly 700 million active monthly users.

articles.author: Samantha Subin
articles.summary: Meta Platforms is launching a standalone artificial intelligence app and going head-to-head with ChatGPT maker OpenAI. Google and Elon Musk's xAI recently released individual apps for their respective digital assistants Gemini and Grok. This is breaking news. Please refresh for updates.

articles.title: Meta launches standalone AI app to take on ChatGPT
articles.author: Samantha Subin
articles.summary: Meta Platforms is launching a stand-alone artificial intelligence app. The new offering will run on Meta's Llama AI model. It includes a Discover feed that shows how others are interacting with the tool and can be used to create images. It competes with other AI platforms such as ChatGPT and Anthropic's Claude, xAI's Grok and Google's Gemini.

articles.title: 6 Jobs Where Women Are Easily Making Over $100K
articles.author: Tobi Opeyemi Amure
articles.summary: According to the 2024 Women in the Workplace report from McKinsey and LeanIn.org, 29% of C-suite positions are held by women, compared with just 17% in 2015. Enterprise tech sales executives are breaking income barriers, typically earning base salaries from $120,000 to $180,000, excluding commissions. AI ethics and policy advisors earn between $100,000 and $200,000. Chief marketing officers (CMOs) and executive coaches earn over $125,000 annually.

articles.title: Meta Launches Standalone AI App to Take On ChatGPT, Grok AI
articles.author: Shubham Verma
articles.summary: Meta has launched a standalone app to let users chat with the company's AI companion using texts, photos, videos, and documents. CEO Mark Zuckerberg said almost Meta AI now has almost 1 billion users. The app has a text field for text-based chats, a microphone for voice conversations, and a tool to generate images. The Discover feed brings social media interactions of people with Meta AI to the app.

articles.title: Platform seeks to lower the barriers to using artificial intelligence in weather research
articles.author: Laura Snider
articles.summary: NSF NCAR has released a new platform to make AI weather models more accessible. The goals are to make it easier to use AI to address science questions at the frontiers of weather research and to allow more researchers to contribute back to expanding the capabilities of AI weather modeling.

articles.title: State of AI in America: New Survey Findings ‘Raise Serious Concerns'
articles.author: Esther Shein
articles.summary: 75% of US respondents are deeply concerned about possible negative outcomes due to AI. 55% of Americans report having experienced inaccurate outcomes from AI. 52% of respondents expressed worry that AI-generated content is manipulating elections, and 85% are calling for laws and actions to combat AI misinformation. In the workplace, 69% of organizations are using AI, and 67% of workers are enhancing their productivity with the tech. However, 44% of employees report using AI in inappropriate ways.

articles.title: Awkward—A.I. Struggles to Understand Human Social Interactions, Study Finds
articles.author: Linda Carroll
articles.summary: A.I. systems still struggle with reading the nuances of human behavior, which is crucial for real-world applications like robotics and self-driving cars. Researchers at Johns Hopkins University and Columbia University presented their findings at the International Conference on Learning Representations last week.

articles.title: Accelirate Launches 5-Week AI Agent Activator Plan to Accelerate Enterprise AI Deployment
articles.summary: Accelirate launches a 5-week AI Agent Activator Plan to help enterprises fast-track secure, scalable AI agent deployment with real-world, ROI-focused outcomes. The program is ideal for businesses looking to deploy agents at speed without the trial-and-error traditionally associated with deploying new technologies.

articles.title: AI Scams To Watch Out For And How To Detect Fake Messages
articles.author: Seattle Medium
articles.summary: According to Bentley University and Gallup report, 56% of Americans believe AI does equal amounts of harm and good. Bad actors use AI tools to deploy sophisticated scams in emails, texts, and other forms of communication. Scammers use generative AI to create convincing phishing emails and fake websites. They can also generate deepfake scam photos, videos, and audio clips.

articles.title: University of Utah Researchers Develop Explainable AI Toolkit to Predict Disease Before Symptoms Appear
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Utah's Department of Psychiatry and Huntsman Mental Health Institute published a paper introducing RiskPath, an open source software toolkit that uses Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) to predict whether individuals will develop progressive and chronic diseases years before symptoms appear. XAI is an artificial intelligence system that can explain complex decisions in ways humans can understand.

articles.title: Meta's ChatGPT competitor shows how your friends use AI
articles.author: Alex Heath
articles.summary: The Meta AI app is a standalone ChatGPT competitor. It's replacing the View companion app for the Meta Ray-Ban smart glasses. The app is powered by a Meta-tuned version of Llama 4. In the US and Canada, Meta uses information from Facebook and Instagram profiles to personalize how its AI assistant responds.

articles.title: Colorado lawmakers, being watched across the country, unveil revisions to artificial intelligence law
articles.author: Tamara Chuang
articles.summary: Senate Bill 318 would change Colorado's controversial artificial intelligence law. It would reduce the administrative tasks smaller companies must take to protect consumers against discrimination if their AI systems are used to decide who gets a job, housing, personal loans, health care, insurance coverage, educational opportunities, or legal or essential government services. The resource-intensive parts of the law would apply only to companies with 500 or more employees worldwide, instead of 50 or more.

articles.title: How Generative Artificial Intelligence Is Changing Work at Argonne National Laboratory
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: Generative artificial intelligence (AI) is becoming an increasingly powerful tool in the workplace. At national laboratories, AI has the potential to accelerate scientific discovery in critical areas, according to the 2025 report.    i.e., it's a tool that can be used to advance scientific discovery.

articles.title: The Listening Universe
articles.author: Dr. Sircus
articles.summary: ChatGPT is promoting 'More than AI – True Intelligence at Depth'. The book details how we can humanize the bridge between man and artificial intelligence and how to use AI for its highest possible purposes. The ad declares that AI will soon be essential to the critical systems that sustain modern life.

articles.title: Study explores how workers are using large language models and what it means for science organizations
articles.author: Argonne National Laboratory
articles.summary: Researchers investigated Argonne National Laboratory employees' use of Argo, an internal generative artificial intelligence chatbot. Argo gives employees secure access to large language models (LLMs) from OpenAI through an internal interface. It was the first internal AI interface to be deployed at a national laboratory. The study found that the AI works as a copilot and as a workflow agent.

articles.title: Final 6 days: Save big and bring a plus-one for 50% off to TechCrunch Sessions: AI
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: TechCrunch Sessions: AI takes place on June 5 at UC Berkeley's Zellerbach Hall. Early Bird pricing ends on May 4 at 11:59 p.m. PT. Get 50% off a second ticket for your co-founder, colleague, or AI-obsessed friend.

articles.title: Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock: SoundHound AI vs. C3.ai
articles.author: Robert Izquierdo
articles.summary: SoundHound AI went public in 2022 and C3.ai went public at the end of 2020. SoundHound developed a voice-activated AI that understands human speech with uncanny precision. C3ai built an enterprise platform encompassing both turnkey and custom AI software for organizations. The AI industry is expected to grow from $184 billion in 2024 to $826 billion by 2030.

articles.title: GigaIO's Power-efficient Interconnect Technology Achieves Breakthrough AI Performance: 2x Faster Training and Fine-Tuning with 83.5x Lower Latency
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: GigaIO is a pioneer in scalable edge-to-core AI platforms for all accelerators that are easy to deploy and manage. GigaIO's AI fabric is 2x faster than RDMA over Converged Ethernet (RoCE) for training and fine-tuning and 83x faster for inferencing.

articles.title: OpenAI adds shopping to ChatGPT — here's how it works
articles.author: Brooke Steinberg
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI-powered search shopping tool developed by OpenAI. Users will soon be able to shop through ChatGPT. The product recommendations are based on data that it remembers about the user's preferences, as well as product reviews from across the internet. The shopping experience is more personalized and conversational than Google Shopping.

articles.title: Dubai Municipality champions AI in revolutionising occupational health and safety
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: Dubai Municipality hosted an event in celebration of World Day for Safety and Health at Work. The event focused on the transformative role of artificial intelligence (AI) in occupational health and safety. It was held at the Canadian University Dubai. It discussed "Artificial Intelligence Trends in Shaping the Future of Occupational Health and Safety"

articles.title: OpenAI adds shopping features to ChatGPT Search
articles.summary: ChatGPT Search allows users to shop for products. Categories available include fashion, beauty, home goods and electronics. OpenAI only made $4 billion last year after spending $9 billion. The company wants to boost revenue by a factor of 30 to $125 billion by 2029.

articles.title: The Great Language Flattening
articles.author: Victoria Turk
articles.summary: AI has already won its campaign for global dominance. Jeremy Nguyen, a senior researcher at Swinburne University of Technology, in Australia, ran an experiment last year to see how exposure to AI-generated text might change the way people write. The results of the experiment are yet to be published or peer-reviewed, but it's an intriguing finding.

articles.title: A New Study Shows How Gen AI May Transform Access To Mental Health Services
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: There is huge potential for AI to transform the wellness and mental health services space, as AI is advancing rapidly.    - Dr. Tim Berners-Lee, CEO of IBM Watson Health, says AI has huge potential to transform this area of health care.

articles.title: Anomali Unveils Deeply Integrated Agentic AI to Supercharge Threat Detection, Investigation, and Response
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: Anomali unveils Anomali Agentic AI at the RSA Conference. It is the latest evolution of Anomli's native AI capabilities enhanced by advanced agentic AI. It enables faster, smarter, and more precise actions and decisions to supercharge security operations.

articles.title: CAI Wins Gold Stevie® Award for Best Technical Support Solution in Computer Services
articles.author: CAI
articles.summary: CAI earned the gold Stevie Award for Best Technical Support Solution in Computer Services. More than 3,600 nominations from organizations of all sizes and in virtually every industry were submitted this year. CAI has improved its Service Desk with innovative capabilities to streamline processes and improve the customer experience.

articles.title: Frontline Insurance Selects Roots' Insurance AI Agent Platform to Enhance Claims and Underwriting Service Levels
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Frontline Insurance has chosen Roots' AI agents to enhance the efficiency of its claims and underwriting operations. Frontline is a leading multi-state Property & Casualty insurer delivering customizable solutions across the Southeastern United States. The AI agents are powered by InsurGPT, which includes proprietary generative AI designed specifically for insurance.

articles.title: AITX's RAD Announces New ROAMEO Gen 4 Order from National Retail Operator
articles.summary: A national retail operator has placed an order for a ROAMEO Gen 4 autonomous security robot vehicle. The mobile device will be deployed to enhance parking lot security during all hours. It is powered by AI-driven detection and real-time communication tools. It helps organizations modernize security operations while dramatically lowering labor expenses.

articles.title: OneMeta Unleashes Real-Time, Zero-Delay Simultaneous Interpretation for Customer Service Centers with VerbumAgentis
articles.summary: VerbumAgentis is the new multilingual communication platform developed by OneMeta Inc. It provides real-time, simultaneous interpretation between agents and customers in their native languages without delays or third-party interpreters. It's already gaining demand in the following sectors: Innovation, Security, and Business.

articles.title: WhatsApp users outraged following addition of ‘pointless and irritating' feature on millions of phones
articles.author: Rikki Loftus
articles.summary: WhatsApp added an artificially intelligent chatbot called Llama 4 to its service. Many WhatsApp users are unhappy with the new feature and the fact that there is no option to remove or disable the chatbot. The chatbot will not be able to access or read any of the content of your messages unless you ask the AI for assistance.

articles.title: A Single Cubic Millimeter of Brain Tissue May Have Just Changed Neuroscience Forever
articles.author: Caroline Delbert
articles.summary: Scientists have mapped an unprecedentedly large portion of the brain of a mouse. The map shows one cubic millimeter worth of neurons in the visual cortex of the mouse's brain. It's the largest piece of a brain we've ever understood to this degree. Machine learning helped the scientists to 'reverse engineer the algorithms of brain.

articles.title: Why there's no AI-driven future without sustainable HPC
articles.author: altair
articles.summary: In the future, artificial intelligence (AI) and data analytics will be powered by high-performance computing (HPC). HPC and AI don't run for free, they use a lot of energy and space. Sustainable HPC must be a top priority as organizations seek to minimize their carbon footprint and meet net-zero goals.

articles.title: Meet Xanfi: Made-in-India GenAI Chatbot Supporting 100+ Languages
articles.author: Musharrat Shahin
articles.summary: Xanfi is a Gen AI-powered chatbot and conversational engine built to assist, create, and communicate in real time across 100+ languages, including 22 Indian languages. Xanfi is trained with a rich Indian dataset that includes Indian languages, cultural nuances, legal terms, regional sentiments, astrology knowledge and more. It works globally with support for 80+ foreign languages.

articles.title: telling AI image generators to slow their roll
articles.author: Lemkin
articles.summary: When iterating with Gemini 2.5 Flash, there seems to be no way to lock in any progress. If not due to a fundamental issue with the technology, a For Dummies explanation why would qualify as a Best Answer.   .

articles.title: Visualizing AI vs. Human Performance In Technical Tasks
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: In the past year, AI systems have surpassed human performance in some technical tasks. This graphic visualizes AI systems' performance relative to human baselines for eight AI benchmarks measuring tasks including: image classification, visual reasoning, English language understanding, multitask language understanding and PhD-level science questions.

articles.title: KSA-Based iMENA Group Raises US$135 Million Ahead Of Its IPO
articles.author: Inc. Arabia Team
articles.summary: ChatGPT Operator is looking for a digital proxy for human interaction. WEE Marketplace Secures $10 million investment in Inc. Arabia EN, which is a chat-based marketplace in the Middle East. It's based in Saudi Arabia. It was founded in 2010.

articles.title: Why Even Try if You Have A.I.?
articles.author: New Yorker
articles.summary: Now that machines can think for us, we have to choose whether to be the passengers or pilots of our lives, as the author says, or the machines that can think on our behalf. The choice is ours to make.    .

articles.title: No AI impact found on jobs even in 'vulnerable' professions
articles.author: Rob Beschizza
articles.summary: AI chatbots have no impact yet on employment levels or wages, even in those occupations that are vulnerable to AI. The report should concern the tech industry, which has hyped AI's economic potential while plowing billions into infrastructure meant to support it. AI has created new job tasks for 8.4 percent of workers.

articles.title: The Future of Work Is AI-Enhanced — Here's How to Prepare Now
articles.author: Daniella Polevoy
articles.summary: According to LinkedIn's Future of Work Report 2025, AI literacy ranks in the top 3 most in-demand skills worldwide. Coursiv is an AI-enabled learning platform that teaches you how to use AI. It's not a course platform, it's an AI gym.

articles.title: Eyeé: The U.S. is in the lead—and will stay there if we focus on quality
articles.summary: Malo Santo, CEO of X. Eyeé, says the U.S. leads in AI but must prioritize quality and talent retention. She warns against losing experts and calls for certified standards for AI deployment in the United States. She also calls for better AI education and training.

articles.title: Cleveland Clinic to implement generative AI for medical coding
articles.author: Julie Washington
articles.summary: The Cleveland Clinic is using AI to review medical codes in a fraction of the time that it takes humans to do the same task. The program will start at two or three Ohio-based Clinic hospitals within the next three or four months. It will roll out across the Clinic's U.S. locations over the next several weeks. The clinic is exploring the use of AI to make up for a shortage of medical coding specialists.

articles.title: How to appropriately use AI in media relations
articles.author: Casey Weldon
articles.summary: Qwoted added a 'Flag for AI' option for journalists shortly after ChatGPT launched. FINN Partners uses AI in four main areas: data analysis, story ideation, conversation transcription and identifying reporters and outlets to pitch. Tino Bovenzi receives more media requests than ever thanks to AI.

articles.title: Rochester area colleges launch AI and workforce-ready programs
articles.author: Andrea Deckert
articles.summary: Nazareth University launches a new Master of Science in Business Analytics and Artificial Intelligence. Monroe Community College debuts certificates in advanced manufacturing, skilled trades and information technology. St. John Fisher introduces degrees in human services and health care. Finger Lakes Workforce Development Center is also introducing many new certificate programs.

articles.title: Turns out AI is really bad at picking up on social cues
articles.author: Joe Berkowitz
articles.summary: According to Ernest Hemingway, the best stories are like icebergs, with what characters say and do located above the surface. According to Leyla Isik, a cognitive scientist at Johns Hopkins University, AI is hopelessly out of its depth at interpreting such things so far.

articles.title: Apr 29, 2025 at 7:00 AM EDT
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Yelp's AI assistant will now be able to match you up with a local service professional with help from AI-powered photo recognition. It could be useful to get assistance with something like a broken appliance, or to get help with a problem with a car.

articles.title: Yelp debuts AI voice agents for restaurants and service providers
articles.author: Ivan Mehta
articles.summary: Yelp is working on deploying AI-powered "voice agents" to help service providers and restaurants handle calls, answer basic questions and accomplish tasks like adding a customer to a restaurant waitlist. The company is using OpenAI's Realtime API to handle end-to-end calling.

articles.title: Meta's AI chatbot business seems like a headache that isn't worth the risk
articles.summary: According to Jeff Horwitz, John Cena's AI chatbot pretended to seduce a 14-year-old girl. John Cena didn't respond to a request for comment in the WSJ story. Zuckerberg approved barring registered teen accounts from accessing user-created bots.

articles.title: OpenAI introduces shopping recommendations to ChatGPT search
articles.author: Your Story
articles.summary: ChatGPT's search feature has become one of its fastest-growing features. Over one billion queries have been made in the past week on ChatGPT in this way. It's one of the fastest growing features of ChatPGT.

articles.title: Renate Nyborg's Meeno wants to become the Duolingo of dating
articles.author: Jessica Bursztynsky
articles.summary: Renate Nyborg launched Meeno less than two years ago with the intention of being an AI chatbot that helped users through relationship issues. Now, the company is pivoting to teach predominantly male users how to connect romantically with women through interactions with voice-based AI characters. The company is raising a seed extension, with $2.7 million committed in the past few weeks.

articles.title: The AI Hype Index: AI agent cyberattacks, racing robots, and musical models
articles.author: The Editors
articles.summary: AI agents are the industry's hypiest new product. They can be useful but could also be weaponized to execute cyberattacks. OpenAI is reported to be throwing its hat into the social media arena and AI models are getting more adept at making music. The results of the first half-marathon pitting humans against humanoid robots suggest that we won't have to worry about the robot uprising any time soon.

articles.title: AI Account Scam: How to Avoid It
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used by cybercriminals to create convincing and effective scams. The FTC received nearly 6 million fraud reports from consumers in 2023, with losses totaling $10.3 billion. The FBI's Internet Crime Complaint centre received a record number of complaints, with reported losses exceeding $12.8 billion.

articles.title: Survey: Most Use AI at Work, Nearly Half Misuse It
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: 58% of employees intentionally use artificial intelligence (AI) at work and a third use it weekly or daily. General-purpose generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT, are the most widely used. Most employees report performance benefits from AI adoption at work. However, almost half of employees who use AI in the workplace have done so in ways that could be considered inappropriate. Complacent use of AI is also widespread, with 66% of respondents relying on AI output without evaluating it.

articles.title: Is Keir Starmer getting advice from AI? The British government will not tell us
articles.author: News Desk
articles.summary: Thousands of civil servants in the British government are using artificial intelligence chatbots to do their own work. The government did not disclose exactly how the tools are used. Experts say that public shortages raise concerns about the government's transparency and the accuracy of information used in the government.

articles.title: Meta's AI chatbot business seems like a headache that isn't worth the risk
articles.author: Katie Notopoulos
articles.summary: Meta's AI chatbots are under scrutiny for allowing sexual talk with teens. John Cena's chatbot pretended to get arrested on charges of statutory rape. Mark Zuckerberg pushed for these chatbots to be loosened up. The most popular chatbots in Meta are romance-oriented, with beautiful women as the image.

articles.title: Using artificial intelligence to pick the Kentucky Derby
articles.summary: Louisville entrepreneur Evan Gunter created a website to use Artificial Intelligence to handicap Kentucky Derby 151. Gunter studied software development at the University of Kentucky. Early trials to try and predict races at Keeneland have been promising. Derby week packages start at $20 for Saturday's races only.

articles.title: Is AI 'normal'?
articles.author: James O'Donnell
articles.summary: A recent essay by two AI researchers at Princeton argues that AI should be treated as a general-purpose technology rather than as a 'superintelligence' than a separate species. They argue that the adoption of useful artificial intelligence will be less of a tsunami and more of a trickle. They also argue that AI can help or hurt inequality, labor markets, the free press and democratic backsliding depending on how it's deployed.

articles.title: ChatGPT as second opinion? AI is changing how patients look at their medical data, doctors little wary
articles.author: Nandini Yadav
articles.summary: ChatGPT's Deep Research feature lets users upload context-rich documents and ask nuanced follow-up questions. Adrian Pauly used it to map out his chronic lower back pain. Dr Ishwar Gilada cautions that ChatGPT is not a replacement for human expertise.

articles.title: ChatGPT Is Actually Not Your Friend, by Froma Harrop
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI chatbot powered by proprietary generative pretrained transformers. It's a supercomputer with 285,000 processor cores, 10,000 GPUs and 400 gigabits per second of connectivity for each graphics card server. It was developed by OpenAI and backed by Microsoft. ChatGPT has been well trained to sound buddy-buddy to users.

articles.title: ChatGPT Is Actually Not Your Friend
articles.author: Froma Harrop
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI chatbot developed by OpenAI and backed by Microsoft. It's a supercomputer with 285,000 processor cores, 10,000 GPUs and 400 gigabits per second of connectivity for each graphics card server. It runs hot and consumes a lot of water. ChatGPT has been trained to sound buddy-buddy to users and flatter them.
